newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent slightly firmer, holiday dulls trade.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent slightly firmer, holiday dulls trade.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures were stable on Wednesday after staging slight early gains, but business was light because of holidays in a number of European countries, traders said.
June Brent was six cents a barrel firmer at 1125 GMT and stood at $18.22 while May gas oil, which expires on Monday, was 50 cents a tonne up at $168.00.
"Precious little going on," one dealer said, adding that traders were unimpressed by news that OPEC was likely to leave its output ceiling unchanged.

OPEC President Libyan Oil Minister Abdullah Salem al-Badri said on Thursday he expected the group to stick with its 25.03 million barrels per day (bpd) output quota when the organisation meets in June.
A Reuters survey on Thursday estimated OPEC's April output at 27.05 million bpd.
Technical analysts were moderately bullish, citing strong support for Brent at $18.00 and then $17.88 beneath that.
